title: The Object, What it is, Where it gets its power, Language & Relationship between Subject and Object
description:
Scroll down for useful links.
Hyon with a background in Marketing, AI and Philosophy, joins us today for a discussion of:
inside/outside
subject/object
idolatry
the role of language
Stephen Wolfram's Theory of Everything
covenantal epistemology (Esther Meek)
epistemology of love (N. T. Wright)
the relationship between ontology and epistemology and the danger of overwriting our ontology and precipitating reciprocal narrowing
Who gives the power to the Object?

From Jordan Peterson: A Psycho-ontological Analysis of Genesis
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/233604448_A_Psycho-ontological_Analysis_of_Genesis_2-6 (choose "read full text" and scroll down and you'll get the whole 40 pages.)

Karen and Michael discuss the possible implications of Stephen Wolfram's Theory of Everything and the Gift of the Layer of Computational Reducibility
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzUEzVZiAoo&t=3418s

Karl Friston and Markov Blankets (the whole thing is interesting but start at 9:38 if you are pressed for time and just watch the summary there.)
https://youtu.be/j53lfLyFOPA?t=578

Hyon's Twitter profile:  https://twitter.com/hyonschu?s=20
Karen's Twitter profile:  https://twitter.com/klwong43

Hyon's conversation with Paul VanderKlay
https://youtu.be/ozhcpLrJsB8
